The terms alternative medicine, complementary medicine, integrative medicine, holistic medicine, natural medicine, unorthodox medicine, fringe medicine, unconventional medicine, and [new age](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_age) medicine are used interchangeably as having the same meaning and are almost synonymous in most contexts. Terminology has shifted over time, reflecting the preferred branding of practitioners. For example, the [United States National Institutes of Health](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_National_Institutes_of_Health) department studying alternative medicine, currently named the [National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Center_for_Complementary_and_Integrative_Health) (NCCIH), was established as the Office of Alternative Medicine (OAM) and was renamed the National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine (NCCAM) before obtaining its current name.
